intro: Psychotria hancorniifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
